911 Calls Seattle Prediction 1.0 documentation
911 Calls Seattle Prediction 1.0 documentation

Documentation¶

src.train_nn.build_and_compile(input_=(1, 394), loss_func='mae')¶

Build and compile a TensorFLow LSTM network.

Parameters

  • input – Shape of the trainining data. Should specify (batch_size or window_size, n_features)

  • loss_func (str) – Loss function to use for training.

Returns

A compiled TensorFlow model.

Return type

tf.keras.Model

src.train_nn.train(model, train_data, train_labels, val_data, val_labels, epochs=300, sample_weights=None)¶

Trains the TensorFlow model.

Parameters

  • model (Model) – A TensorFlow compiled model.

  • train_data (DataFrame) – The data to be trained. Shape must be consistent with what is passed during model compilation.

  • train_labels (DataFrame) – The ground truth predictions.

  • val_data (DataFrame) – The data to be used as validation.

  • val_labels (DataFrame) – The ground truth validation predictions.

  • epochs (int) – Total number of epochs to train.

  • sample_weights (Optional[array]) – Weights for train_data to use during training.

Returns

Training information.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

src.train_nn.train_stats(history_df)¶

Produces training statistics once training has run its course.

Parameters

history_df (DataFrame) – The history as returned by Keras fit method .

Returns

Return type

None

Test¶

src.test.test_gb()¶

Provides testing data for the sk learn model.

Return type

None

src.test.test_nn()¶

Provides testing data for the trained neural network.

Return type

None

Utility¶

src.utility.count_lossy_error(predictions, labels, tolerance=2)¶

Compares the predictions and labels with a tolerance.

Parameters

  • predictions (Iterable) – An array of predicted values.

  • labels (Iterable) – An array of actual values.

  • tolerance (float) – A number within which the error is acceptable.

Returns

The accuracy of the predictions with tolerance.

Return type

float

Raises

AttributeError: – If predictions and labels are not of the same length.

src.utility.scale(data, cols=None, type='mean')¶

Normalises columns of data using the method type.

Parameters

  • data (DataFrame) – The dataframe who’s columns need to be normalised.

  • cols (Optional[List[str]]) – The columnss to be normalised. By deafult is None which mean normalises the entire dataframe.

  • type (str) – Acceptable methods are mean and min-max.

Returns

A normalised version of the input dataframe.

Return type

pd.DataFrame
